docs.lead_paragraph: A fascinating new exhibition at the Museum of Sex about the history of the condom suggests that these commonplace objects are icons of far more than the phallus.

headline.seo: The Condom Unrolled at the Museum of Sex
headline.content_kicker: Exhibition Review | 'Rubbers: The Life, History & Struggle of the Condom'

docs.snippet: A fascinating new exhibition at the Museum of Sex about the history of the condom suggests that these commonplace objects are icons of far more than the phallus.

docs.lead_paragraph: BASSOLA-HEALY--Sarah Jean, 26 years old, of Jupiter, FL, passed away unexpectedly, on Monday, February 1, 2010. Born in Australia, Sarah grew up on Long Island, NY, moved into New York City and later to Santa Monica, CA. Sarah is a graduate of Our Lady of Mercy Academy, Syosset, NY and also holds an Associates Degree from Santa Monica City College. She was also preparing for her Florida State Real Estate License. Sarah recently purchased a home with her sisters in Jupiter, FL, that she was renovating. Her legacy includes helping her family to live each day with happiness and illuminating the room like the brightest shinning star. A devoted daughter and sister, She was the daughter of Kathryn Healy, stepdaughter of Daniel Healy, Sr. and daughter of Barry Bassola, and sister to Angela, Camilla, Mary, Daniel, Jr., Matthew, and Christine Healy. Friends may visit with the family between the hours of 6 to 8pm on Friday, February 5, 2010 at Quattlebaum Funeral Home, 1201 South Olive Avenue, West Palm Beach, FL. A Funeral Mass will be held at 9:30am on Saturday, February 6, 2010, at St. Patrick's Church, 13591 Prosperity Farms Road, Palm Beach Gardens, FL. Cremation will follow. To express condolences and share memories, please visit Sarah's Memorial Website at: www.quattlebaum.org. In lieu of flowers, donations can be made to The Sarah Jean Ectopic Pregnancy Foundation. Mr. Daniel Healy, Sr., Premier American Bank, N.A., 5301 Blue Lagoon Drive, Miami, FL 33126.
